metadata.title: CVE-2021-47320 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nfs:fix acl memory leak of posix_acl_create() When looking into another nfsxfstests report, I found acl and default_acl in nfs3_proc_create() andnfs3_proc_mknod() error paths are possibly leaked. Fix them in advance.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47320` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-azure - 4.15.0-1123.136~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.136~14.04.1').
